description: Remote code execution via unsafe deserialization of user input.
Improper authentication allows attackers to bypass login controls.
Improper restriction of XML external entity reference (XXE) in XML parser.
Improper privilege management allows elevation of user roles.
Improper neutralization of input during web page generation (XSS) leading to full session hijack.
Improper control of generation of code ('Code Injection') in dynamic script execution.
SQL injection vulnerability due to unsafe string formatting in SQL query.
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability due to unescaped user input rendered in HTML.
Hardcoded credentials expose sensitive information in source code.
Insecure direct object reference (IDOR) allows unauthorized access to user data.
Improper validation of certificate with host mismatch.
Improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS command (Command Injection).
Improper access control on admin endpoints allows privilege escalation.
Improper handling of file uploads allows arbitrary file write.
Use of broken or risky cryptographic algorithm (e.g., RC4).
Use of weak cryptographic hash function MD5 for password hashing.
Use of predictable random number generator for token generation.
Missing rate limiting on login endpoint may allow brute-force attacks.
Improper error handling reveals stack traces to users.
Insufficient logging of security-relevant events.
Improper input validation in file path handling.
Server version disclosure in HTTP response headers.
Verbose error messages reveal internal implementation details.
Deprecated API usage detected in legacy module.
Missing security headers (e.g., X-Content-Type-Options).
Unvalidated redirect allows phishing via crafted URLs.
Debug logging is enabled in production environment.
Unreferenced JavaScript file found in public directory.
Commented-out code contains sensitive information.
Unencrypted HTTP used for internal API calls.
Unused import statements found in multiple files.
